Name: National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST) Cybersecurity Framework (CSF) v2.0
Description: The NIST Cybersecurity Framework (CSF) 2.0 offers a taxonomy of high-level cybersecurity outcomes that can be used by any organization regardless of its size, sector, or maturity to better understand, assess, prioritize, and communicate its cybersecurity efforts. The framework's core functions are organized into six key areas: Govern (new), Identify, Protect, Detect, Respond, and Recover. Together, these functions provide a comprehensive lifecycle approach to managing cybersecurity risk.

Requirements.Name: GV.OC-1
Requirements.Description: The organization's role in the supply chain is identified and communicated.

Requirements.Name: GV.OC-2
Requirements.Description: Legal, regulatory, and contractual requirements regarding cybersecurity including privacy and civil liberties obligations are understood and managed.

Requirements.Name: GV.OC-3
Requirements.Description: The organization's place in critical infrastructure and its industry sector is identified and communicated.

Requirements.Name: GV.RM-1
Requirements.Description: Organizational cybersecurity risk management strategy is established, communicated, and maintained.

Requirements.Name: GV.RM-2
Requirements.Description: Organizational risk tolerance is determined and clearly expressed.

Requirements.Name: GV.RM-3
Requirements.Description: The organization's determination of risk tolerance is informed by its role in critical infrastructure, sector-specific risk analysis, or organizational risk analysis.

Requirements.Name: GV.SC-1
Requirements.Description: Cybersecurity supply chain risk management processes are identified, established, assessed, managed, and agreed to by organizational stakeholders.

Requirements.Name: GV.SC-2
Requirements.Description: Supply chain risk management processes are established, managed, and agreed to by organizational stakeholders.

Requirements.Name: GV.SC-3
Requirements.Description: Suppliers and third-party partners are evaluated, assessed, and monitored using cybersecurity supply chain risk management processes.

Requirements.Name: GV.SC-4
Requirements.Description: Supply chain risk management processes are continuously improved.

Requirements.Name: GV.RR-1
Requirements.Description: Cybersecurity roles and responsibilities are coordinated and aligned with internal roles and external partners.

Requirements.Name: GV.RR-2
Requirements.Description: Cybersecurity responsibilities are established and communicated.

Requirements.Name: GV.RR-3
Requirements.Description: Senior executives are accountable for cybersecurity risk.

Requirements.Name: GV.PO-1
Requirements.Description: Cybersecurity policy is established, communicated, and enforced.

Requirements.Name: GV.PO-2
Requirements.Description: Cybersecurity policy is updated as needed to reflect changes in organizational priorities, threat landscape, or technology.

Requirements.Name: GV.PO-3
Requirements.Description: Legal and regulatory requirements regarding cybersecurity, including privacy and civil liberties obligations, are understood and managed.

Requirements.Name: GV.PO-4
Requirements.Description: Governance and risk management processes address cybersecurity risks.

Requirements.Name: GV.PO-5
Requirements.Description: Processes for managing cybersecurity requirements for suppliers and third-party partners are established.

Requirements.Name: GV.OV-1
Requirements.Description: Cybersecurity risk management strategy outcomes are reviewed to inform and adjust organizational priorities.

Requirements.Name: GV.OV-2
Requirements.Description: Cybersecurity risk management performance is measured and reported.

Requirements.Name: GV.OV-3
Requirements.Description: Cybersecurity risk management strategy and practices are reviewed and adjusted to adapt to changes in the threat landscape, technologies, or mission, business, or system environments.

Requirements.Name: GV.OV-4
Requirements.Description: Cybersecurity risk management processes are reviewed to ensure they meet legal and regulatory requirements.

Requirements.Name: ID.AM-1
Requirements.Description: Physical devices and systems within the organization are inventoried.

Requirements.Name: ID.AM-2
Requirements.Description: Software platforms and applications within the organization are inventoried.

Requirements.Name: ID.AM-3
Requirements.Description: Organizational communication and data flows are mapped.

Requirements.Name: ID.AM-5
Requirements.Description: Resources (e.g., hardware, devices, data, time, personnel, and software) are prioritized based on their classification, criticality, and business value.

Requirements.Name: ID.AM-6
Requirements.Description: Cybersecurity roles and responsibilities for the entire workforce and third-party stakeholders (e.g., suppliers, customers, partners) are established.

Requirements.Name: ID.BE-5
Requirements.Description: Resilience requirements to support delivery of critical services are established for all operating states (e.g. under duress/attack, during recovery, normal operations)

Requirements.Name: ID.RA-1
Requirements.Description: Asset vulnerabilities are identified and documented.

Requirements.Name: ID.RA-2
Requirements.Description: Cyber threat intelligence is received from information sharing forums and sources.

Requirements.Name: ID.RA-3
Requirements.Description: Threats, both internal and external, are identified and documented.

Requirements.Name: ID.RA-5
Requirements.Description: Threats, vulnerabilities, likelihoods, and impacts are used to determine risk.

Requirements.Name: ID.SC-4
Requirements.Description: Suppliers and third-party partners are routinely assessed using audits, test results, or other forms of evaluations to confirm they are meeting their contractual obligations.

Requirements.Name: PR.AC-1
Requirements.Description: Identities and credentials are issued, managed, verified, revoked, and audited for authorized devices, users and processes.

Requirements.Name: PR.AC-3
Requirements.Description: Remote access is managed.

Requirements.Name: PR.AC-4
Requirements.Description: Access permissions and authorizations are managed, incorporating the principles of least privilege and separation of duties.

Requirements.Name: PR.AC-5
Requirements.Description: Network integrity is protected (e.g., network segregation, network segmentation).

Requirements.Name: PR.AC-6
Requirements.Description: Identities are proofed and bound to credentials and asserted in interactions.

Requirements.Name: PR.AC-7
Requirements.Description: Users, devices, and other assets are authenticated (e.g., single-factor, multi-factor) commensurate with the risk of the transaction (e.g., individuals' security and privacy risks and other organizational risks).

Requirements.Name: PR.DS-1
Requirements.Description: Data-at-rest is protected.

Requirements.Name: PR.DS-2
Requirements.Description: Data-in-transit is protected.

Requirements.Name: PR.DS-3
Requirements.Description: Assets are formally managed throughout removal, transfers, and disposition.

Requirements.Name: PR.DS-4
Requirements.Description: Adequate capacity to ensure availability is maintained.

Requirements.Name: PR.DS-5
Requirements.Description: Protections against data leaks are implemented.

Requirements.Name: PR.DS-6
Requirements.Description: Integrity checking mechanisms are used to verify software, firmware, and information integrity.

Requirements.Name: PR.DS-7
Requirements.Description: The development and testing environment(s) are separate from the production environment.

Requirements.Name: PR.DS-8
Requirements.Description: Integrity checking mechanisms are used to verify hardware integrity.

Requirements.Name: PR.IP-1
Requirements.Description: A baseline configuration of information technology/industrial control systems is created and maintained incorporating security principles (e.g. concept of least functionality).

Requirements.Name: PR.IP-2
Requirements.Description: A System Development Life Cycle to manage systems is implemented.

Requirements.Name: PR.IP-3
Requirements.Description: Configuration change control processes are in place.

Requirements.Name: PR.IP-4
Requirements.Description: Backups of information are conducted, maintained, and tested periodically.

Requirements.Name: PR.IP-7
Requirements.Description: Protection processes are improved.

Requirements.Name: PR.IP-8
Requirements.Description: Effectiveness of protection technologies is shared.

Requirements.Name: PR.IP-9
Requirements.Description: Response plans (Incident Response and Business Continuity) and recovery plans (Incident Recovery and Disaster Recovery) are in place and managed.

Requirements.Name: PR.IP-12
Requirements.Description: A vulnerability management plan is developed and implemented.

Requirements.Name: PR.MA-2
Requirements.Description: Remote maintenance of organizational assets is approved, logged, and performed in a manner that prevents unauthorized access.

Requirements.Name: PR.PT-1
Requirements.Description: Audit/log records are determined, documented, implemented, and reviewed in accordance with policy.

Requirements.Name: PR.PT-3
Requirements.Description: The principle of least functionality is incorporated by configuring systems to provide only essential capabilities.

Requirements.Name: PR.PT-4
Requirements.Description: Communications and control networks are protected.

Requirements.Name: PR.PT-5
Requirements.Description: Mechanisms (e.g., failsafe, load balancing, hot swap) are implemented to achieve resilience requirements in normal and adverse situations.

Requirements.Name: DE.AE-1
Requirements.Description: A baseline of network operations and expected data flows for users and systems is established and managed.

Requirements.Name: DE.AE-2
Requirements.Description: Detected events are analyzed to understand attack targets and methods.

Requirements.Name: DE.AE-3
Requirements.Description: Event data are collected and correlated from multiple sources and sensors.

Requirements.Name: DE.AE-4
Requirements.Description: Impact of events is determined.

Requirements.Name: DE.AE-5
Requirements.Description: Incident alert thresholds are established.

Requirements.Name: DE.CM-1
Requirements.Description: The network is monitored to detect potential cybersecurity events.

Requirements.Name: DE.CM-2
Requirements.Description: The physical environment is monitored to detect potential cybersecurity events.

Requirements.Name: DE.CM-3
Requirements.Description: Personnel activity is monitored to detect potential cybersecurity events.

Requirements.Name: DE.CM-4
Requirements.Description: Malicious code is detected.

Requirements.Name: DE.CM-5
Requirements.Description: Unauthorized mobile code is detected.

Requirements.Name: DE.CM-6
Requirements.Description: External service provider activity is monitored to detect potential cybersecurity events.

Requirements.Name: DE.CM-7
Requirements.Description: Monitoring for unauthorized personnel, connections, devices, and software is performed.

Requirements.Name: DE.DP-4
Requirements.Description: Event detection information is communicated.

Requirements.Name: DE.DP-5
Requirements.Description: Detection processes are continuously improved.

Requirements.Name: RS.AN-2
Requirements.Description: The impact of the incident is understood.

Requirements.Name: RS.MI-3
Requirements.Description: Newly identified vulnerabilities are mitigated or documented as accepted risks.

Requirements.Name: RS.RP-1
Requirements.Description: Response plan is executed during or after an incident.

Requirements.Name: RC.RP-1
Requirements.Description: Recovery plan is executed during or after a cybersecurity incident.
